title: Our FATHER Who Art in HEAVEN
body_text:
FATHER-SON Team Combinations:
The Spengemans take on the Corneros in an ECD First!
It was just one of the nights where anything and everything happened. The  headliners themselves - two beloved Father/Son pairs - were already enough to provide a kick-ass, high-intensity main event and nothing or no one would prove otherwise, or so it was thought.
In the early-goings, each of the family duos swapped victories to open things up. A fine start to this magnificently star-studded contest until ...
In the midst of a heated Game 3, Wall Township Police Officers unexpectedly entered the worshipped battlegrounds, figuratively holding a giant stop sign on the action.
EastCoastDodgeball's
modern day warriors were shocked and angered and yet had no alternative but to obey such orders.
But the turmoil surrounding the situation folded under and after impatiently awaiting Officer Borist's green light to continue, DODGEBALL 155 resumed without a hitch and all those present, from the sideline crowd to the soldiers in combat, enjoyed what was left of an already-spectacular and unpredictable Season 16 midway showdown.
The final two rounds of the night were as close as they come. Team regenerators were smacked and bodies permanently bruised all in effort to come out on top.
Flash Results by Game
Spengeman: 1, 3, 4
Cornero: 2
The end result saw the dare-devil Spengemans emerge with their arms raised in triumph.
Team SPENGEMAN 3. Team CORNERO 1.
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Dan Spengeman and Mr. Spengeman defeated Bob Cornero and Mr. Cornero, 3 - 1, in the first-ever
Father/Son
team attraction.
Captains Statistics
: Dan Spengeman was the only one of the four with any prior captains experience, improving his record is 4-1-0. Mr. Spengeman set his own record becoming the oldest captain in history at the age of 63. Hats off!
Moments & Stars
: Steve Pham playing with a broken finger
Attendance
: 30, comprised of 23 men and 7 women
New Players
: Christie Peace
Other Notes
: In the three-plus years of
EastCoastDodgeball
, this was the first time play was actually stopped because of a police order. Captain Dan Spengeman provided the music for the event.
Thank You!
EastCoastDodgeball
couldn't be more pleased with the participation of such respected patriarchs Mr. Spengeman and Mr. Cornero. They are certainly thanked for their continued support and
we
hope to see them on the dodgeball court very soon.
Online Exclusive!
DODGEBALL 155's main event was planned in mid-August, right around the time of superstar Grant Cornero's ECD departure.
________________________________________
_______________
Up Next ...
How's about we try something new.
In the aftermath of the colossal Father-Son outing,
EastCoastDodgeball
invites you to try out this new, yet unfamiliar game type. To say the newly-coined phrase "Non-stop Dodgeball!" may have a slightly different meaning after DODGEBALL 156 is all said and done would surely be an understatement. Come on out September 20 to find out what's going on!
body_html:
FATHER-SON Team Combinations:
The Spengemans take on the Corneros in an ECD First!

It was just one of the nights where anything and everything happened. The headliners themselves - two beloved Father/Son pairs - were already enough to provide a kick-ass, high-intensity main event and nothing or no one would prove otherwise, or so it was thought.

In the early-goings, each of the family duos swapped victories to open things up. A fine start to this magnificently star-studded contest until ...

In the midst of a heated Game 3, Wall Township Police Officers unexpectedly entered the worshipped battlegrounds, figuratively holding a giant stop sign on the action. EastCoastDodgeball's modern day warriors were shocked and angered and yet had no alternative but to obey such orders.

But the turmoil surrounding the situation folded under and after impatiently awaiting Officer Borist's green light to continue, DODGEBALL 155 resumed without a hitch and all those present, from the sideline crowd to the soldiers in combat, enjoyed what was left of an already-spectacular and unpredictable Season 16 midway showdown.

The final two rounds of the night were as close as they come. Team regenerators were smacked and bodies permanently bruised all in effort to come out on top.

Flash Results by Game
Spengeman: 1, 3, 4
Cornero: 2

The end result saw the dare-devil Spengemans emerge with their arms raised in triumph.
Team SPENGEMAN 3. Team CORNERO 1.

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Dan Spengeman and Mr. Spengeman defeated Bob Cornero and Mr. Cornero, 3 - 1, in the first-ever Father/Son team attraction.
Captains Statistics: Dan Spengeman was the only one of the four with any prior captains experience, improving his record is 4-1-0. Mr. Spengeman set his own record becoming the oldest captain in history at the age of 63. Hats off!
Moments & Stars: Steve Pham playing with a broken finger
Attendance: 30, comprised of 23 men and 7 women
New Players: Christie Peace
Other Notes: In the three-plus years of EastCoastDodgeball, this was the first time play was actually stopped because of a police order. Captain Dan Spengeman provided the music for the event.

Thank You!
EastCoastDodgeball couldn't be more pleased with the participation of such respected patriarchs Mr. Spengeman and Mr. Cornero. They are certainly thanked for their continued support and we hope to see them on the dodgeball court very soon.

Online Exclusive!
DODGEBALL 155's main event was planned in mid-August, right around the time of superstar Grant Cornero's ECD departure.

_______________________________________________________

Up Next ...

How's about we try something new.

In the aftermath of the colossal Father-Son outing, EastCoastDodgeball invites you to try out this new, yet unfamiliar game type. To say the newly-coined phrase "Non-stop Dodgeball!" may have a slightly different meaning after DODGEBALL 156 is all said and done would surely be an understatement. Come on out September 20 to find out what's going on!
